newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nippon Mining to boost copper smelting capacity.
newsitem.headline: Nippon Mining to boost copper smelting capacity.

text.p: Nippon Mining and Metals Co said on Wednesday that it plans to boost its copper smelting capacity by 70,000 tonnes to 420,000 tonnes per year by 1999.
It also plans to boost its electrolytic copper refining capacity by 40,000 tonnes to 390,000 tonnes per year during the same period.
The firm estimated the total cost of the expansion at 5.5 billion yen.

"We have embarked on a phase-two structural improvement plan aimed at responding to domestic and East Asian market needs while further improving cost and quality competitiveness," the company said in a statement.
It added that the expansion would take place at its Saganoseki smelter and refinery and at its Hitachi refinery.
